definitions: the quality of having a solid, almost unyielding surface or structure

examples.text: he tested the firmness of the mattress
I felt the firmness of his upper arm

shortDefinitions: quality of having solid, unyielding surface or structure

definitions: the application of steady but not excessive power or strength

examples.text: the firmness of his hand on my chest
he sang with a wonderful firmness of tone

shortDefinitions: application of steady but not excessive power or strength

definitions: resolute determination and strength of character

examples.text: his firmness of purpose gained him a devoted following

shortDefinitions: resolute determination and strength of character

definitions: the state of being fixed, definite, or constant

examples.text: so certain were we of the firmness of our plan
the continuing firmness of oil prices

shortDefinitions: state of being fixed, definite, or constant
